column1: '''Lord of Andúnië''' was a title of the [[Númenóreans
column2: Númenórean]] lords of the shoreland region of [[Andustar]] in western [[Númenor]] and ruled the city [[Andúnië]].<ref>{{UT

column1: As rulers of one of the divisions of Númenor the Lords of Andúnië were members of the [[Council of the Sceptre]], and also were the highest lords of the Island and chief councellors of the [[Kings of Númenor]].<ref>{{UT
Their symbol of office was a [[Sceptre of Annúminas
column2: silver sceptre]] which was afterwards held by the [[Kings of Arnor]]. The Lords also had inherited the [[Ring of Barahir]] from the royal house<ref>{{UT
column3: Numenor}}, Note 2</ref>, the [[Elendilmir]] from [[Silmariën]], and were given the [[Palantiri]] by the [[Elves]].

column1: The fourth King of [[Númenor]], [[Tar-Elendil]], was the first King whose eldest child was a daughter. Silmariën, as a woman, could not receive the [[Sceptre of Númenor]] and the King created the title of the Lords of Andúnië in favor of her son, [[Valandil (Lord of Andúnië)

In later times some of the Kings of Númenor would marry women from the royal line of the Lords of Andúnië. From these marriages came the Kings [[Ar-Sakalthôr]] and the wise King [[Tar-Palantir]].<ref>{{UT

When the [[Shadow]] fell on the Kingdom, the Lords remained [[Faithful]] and became the leaders of the [[Elf-friends]], but still retained their office during those dark times until [[Ar-Pharazôn]] stripped Amandil from his offices for supporting the Faithful.<ref name="Akallabeth"/> Amandil's descendants would go on to found the Kingdoms of [[Arnor]] and [[Gondor]].

A family of [[Faithful]] from [[Númenor]] had ruled over the land of [[Belfalas]] since the [[Second Age]]. This family of [[Númenóreans]] were akin to the Lords of Andúnië, and thus related to [[Elendil]].<ref>{{UT
column2: Cirion}}</ref>  After the [[Downfall of Númenor]] they had been given the title ''Prince of Belfalas'' by [[Elendil]]<ref>{{UT
